Module logsweet.core¶

This module contains the core functionality.

logsweet.core.broadcast_lines(bind_address: str, file_glob: str, all_lines: bool = False, tail_lines: int = 0, encoding: Optional[str] = None, name: str = 'unknown', silent: bool = False)[source]¶

Start following text files, broadcasting newlines via an ZeroMQ PUB socket.

Parameters:
  • file_glob (str) – A path to the text file to tail.
  • bind_address (str) – The address to bind the socket to.
  • all_lines (bool) – A flag to indicate if already existing content of the file should be broadcasted.
  • tail_lines (int) – Indicates a number of trailing lines to broadcast before following new lines.
  • name (str) – The name of this broadcaster.
  • silent (bool) – If False, new lines are printed to the console.
  • encoding (Optional[str]) – Specifies the encoding for reading the text files. If None defaults to preferred encoding of current user.
logsweet.core.listen_to_lines(addresses: Sequence[str], interval: float = 0.1)[source]¶

Subscribes to a number of ZeroMQ PUB sockets and prints the received lines.

Parameters:
  • addresses (Sequence[str]) – An iterable with multiple addresses; each in the format of <ip>:<port>.
  • interval (float) – The timeout in seconds when waiting for new messages before handling possible interruption.
logsweet.core.write_logfiles(logfiles: Sequence[str], interval: float = 0.5)[source]¶

Writes random entries into one or multiple logfiles.

Parameters:
  • logfiles (Sequence[str]) – An iterable with filenames to logfiles.
  • interval (float) – The interval for entry generation in seconds.
